title: Regional Account Executive - SMB/MM (LATAM) (Hybrid) (Portuguese Speaking)
description:
About KnowBe4

KnowBe4, the provider of the world's largest security awareness training and simulated phishing platform, is used by tens of thousands of organizations around the globe. KnowBe4 enables organizations to manage the ongoing problem of social engineering by helping them train employees to make smarter security decisions, every day.

Fortune has ranked us as a best place to work for women, for millennials, and in technology for four years in a row! We have been certified as a "Great Place To Work" in 8 countries, plus we've earned numerous other prestigious awards, including Glassdoor's Best Places To Work.

Our team values radical transparency, extreme ownership, and continuous professional development in a welcoming workplace that encourages all employees to be themselves. Whether working remotely or in-person, we strive to make every day fun and engaging; from team lunches to trivia competitions to local outings, there is always something exciting happening at KnowBe4.

Please submit your resume in English.

To learn more about our team and office culture in São Paulo, Brazil, visit the following links.
Careers Page: />Glassdoor : />LinkedIn :

Position Overview:

The Regional Account Executive (SMB/MM) (LATAM) position is responsible for acquiring new logos and upselling our existing SMB/MM-sized customer accounts with the goal of maximizing all revenue opportunities to exceed their monthly sales quota. This can be achieved by creating opportunities through various prospecting methods, following up on inbound leads, reigniting open, outstanding customer opportunities, and motivating our existing customers to purchase additional products, increase subscription levels and/or add on additional seats due to account growth.

Responsibilities:

  • Acquire SMB/MM Business-sized accounts within assigned territory to meet and exceed monthly new logo sales quota.
  • Promote and sell KnowBe4’s range of products to existing customers to meet and exceed SMB/MM Business monthly cross sale and expansion sales quota.
  • Build and maintain a pipeline of SMB/MM business opportunities by various prospecting methods, following lead cadence best practices and conducting demos of our suite of products.
  • Follow up on new and existing customer SDR, marketing and channel leads to generate revenue opportunities and pipeline.
  • Articulate the value proposition of KnowBe4’s full suite of products and educate the customer how each product will improve their business’s human firewall.
  • Understand an organization’s buying needs, key decision makers, potential roadblocks and next steps to shorten sales cycles and acquire a high volume of new logo and upselling existing customer accounts.
  • Act strategically in offering subscription levels, multi-year deals and/or negotiating discounted pricing to increase ARR.
  • Maintain accurate and thorough records of daily sales statistics via Salesforce.
  • Collaborate with the assigned Channel sales representative to seamlessly close new logos through our Partner business channels.
  • Collaborate with the assigned Customer Success Managers and Renewal Specialists to understand the account’s organizational structure, gaps in cybersecurity and ultimately increase their commitment and use of the KnowBe4 Product Suite.
  • Support in the renewal process where there is an opportunity to grow the account.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 2 years experience selling to SMB/MM-sized businesses, required
  • Bachelor Degree or higher education equivalent, desirable
  • Familiarity with standard concepts, practices and procedures within the IT, Security or Cybersecurity industry, desirable
  • Experience with Salesforce, a plus
  • Experience with Gmail and Google Docs
  • Experience with MS Office (Word and Excel)
  • Experience with web browsers (Chrome, Internet Explorer,etc.)
  • Excellent verbal and written communications
  • Fluent in Portuguese
  • Stats driven business professional
  • Motivated, energetic self-starter
  • Strong collaborative and teamwork skills
  • Must be able to work with minimum supervision

Our Fantastic Benefits:

We offer company-wide bonuses based on monthly sales targets, employee referral bonuses, adoption assistance, tuition reimbursement, certification reimbursement, certification completion bonuses, and a relaxed dress code - all in a modern, high-tech, and fun work environment. For more details about our benefits in each office location, please visit

title: Payroll Specialist Lead - Brazil
description:
About Remote

Remote is solving global remote organizations’ biggest challenge: employing anyone anywhere compliantly. We make it possible for businesses big and small to employ a global team by handling global payroll, benefits, taxes, and compliance. Check out remote.com/how-it-works to learn more or if you’re interested in adding to the mission, scroll down to apply now.

Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age, abilities, disability status and any other under-represented group to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging. We have 4 ERGs (Women, Disability, Queer, Minorities in Tech) who meet regularly with the People team. During your interviews and beyond, we ask & encourage anybody who needs an accommodation to request one from their recruiter.

At Remote, we embrace AI as a valuable tool while prioritizing human creativity and authenticity. We look forward to meeting candidates who balance innovation with genuine expertise and experience. To learn more about Remote's AI guidelines check see here.

All of our positions are fully remote. You do not have to relocate to join us!

What this job can offer you

This is an exciting time to join Remote and make a personal difference in the global employment space as a Payroll Specialist Lead joining our Global Payroll Operations Team.

What you bring
  • In-house payroll management or equivalent experience
  • Knowledge of payroll best practices.
  • Proficient in using software tools like SAP, Excel / Google Sheet.
  • An analytical mindset with great problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, international work environment with a passion for making an impact.
  • Is a productivity geek and will constantly think of ways to improve and speed up their work.
  • You understand the need and ideal to work largely asynchronously.
  • Writes and speaks fluent English
  • It's not required to have experience working remotely, but considered a plus
Key Responsibilities
  • Act as a true subject matter expert for Brazil
    • Manage existing relationships with key stakeholders within Payroll Implementation, Finance, Product, Engineers.
    • Process full end to end payroll in-house, statutory filing requirements, exceptions, approvals, payments and compliance.
    • Ensure full data integrity and quality
  • Accounting/reconciliations
  • Focus on KPIs and SLAs
  • Implement and improve processes
  • Mentor and support payroll specialists
  • Back up regional managers during times of absence
Practicals
  • You'll report to: Associate Manager, Payroll Operations
  • Direct reports: N/A
  • Team: Payroll - Payroll Operations
  • Location : For this position we welcome everyone to apply, but we will prioritize applications from Brazil and LATAM as we encourage our teams to diversify
  • Start date: As soon as possible
Remote Compensation Philosophy

Remote's Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.

At first glance our salary bands seem quite wide - here is some context. At Remote we have international operations and a globally distributed workforce. We use geo ranges to consider geographic pay differentials as part of our global compensation strategy to remain competitive in various markets while hiring globally.

The base salary range for this full-time position is $33,300 to $74,850. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.


At Remote, we foster internal mobility as a key element of our culture of employee growth and development, supported by a compensation philosophy that guarantees pay equity and fairness. Therefore, all compensation changes associated with an internal move will be reviewed by the Total Rewards & People Enablement team on a case by case basis.

Application process
  1. Interview with recruiter
  2. Interview with future manager
  3. Interview with team members (no managers present)
  4. Bar Raiser Interview
  5. Prior employment verification check
Benefits Our full benefits & perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits. As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits/perks are for all Remoters:
  • work from anywhere
  • flexible paid time off
  • flexible working hours (we are async)
  • 16 weeks paid parental leave
  • mental health support services
  • stock options
  • learning budget
  • home office budget & IT equipment
  • budget for local in-person social events or co-working spaces
How you’ll plan your day (and life)

We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async.

You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your life-work balance is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.

If that sounds like something you want, apply now!

How to apply
  1. Please fill out the form below and upload your CV with a PDF format.
  2. We kindly ask you to submit your application and CV in English, as this is the standardized language we use here at Remote.
  3. If you don’t have an up to date CV but you are still interested in talking to us, please feel free to add a copy of your LinkedIn profile instead.

We will ask you to voluntarily tell us your pronouns at interview stage, and you will have the option to answer our anonymous demographic questionnaire when you apply below. As an equal employment opportunity employer it’s important to us that our workforce reflects people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences and this data will help us to stay accountable. We thank you for providing this data, if you chose to.

At Remote, we embrace AI as a valuable tool while prioritizing human creativity and authenticity. We look forward to meeting candidates who balance innovation with genuine expertise and experience. To learn more about Remote's AI guidelines check see here.

Please note we accept applications on an ongoing basis.

title: Regional Area Manager (South America) Operations · EM&I Brazil - Macae
description:
Job Title

Regional Director – South America

Reporting to

CEO with close direction and liaison with Global Director of Operations (GDOO) for operational matters

Role

Leading EM&I’s South American operational delivery and stated associated support functions:

  1. Member of the Leadership Team (LT) with attendance of Weekly LT Meeting (video) and other ad-hoc and scheduled LT meetings (video and in-person, as required).
  2. Responsible for cash generation for all projects delivered across the South American region, based on a guaranteed level of revenue and final approved project gross margin modelled developed as part of the proposal submission by the Business Development (BD) team.
  3. Responsible for managing specified overheads attributable to each operational base in the South American region, such overheads being those needed to satisfy the cash generation responsibility assigned to the Regional Area Manager. This includes the development of regional budgets (using EM&I’s (internal and external) project based system) as well as forecasting, reviewing and reporting.
  4. Responsible for delivering projects / contracts (and programmes of projects within contracts) safely, to the required quality standard whilst meeting or exceeding client expectations (by means of FPAL or equivalent formal client feedback mechanism), to the modelled financial targets (project gross margin, WIP, and debt) and within budget / sales forecast, and contractual timescales.
  5. Responsible for leading the Brazilian office and site based team, notably including SHEQ, HR, and TD personnel.
  6. Responsibility for equipment allocated to the region by the GDOO.
  7. Responsible for safety, health, quality, and environmental performance of site and onshore operations in the region.
  8. Responsible for establishing and maintaining excellent client relationships in partnership with the Director of Regional Development (DRD) - South America.
  9. Responsible for providing technical and operational input to the DRD - South America.
  10. Responsible for regional compliance with SHEQ, operational, technical, administration and communications, HR, and ICT processes and procedures in accordance with EM&I global standards.
  11. Responsible for reviewing the payroll in close liaison with the CFO, Global Head of HR and their teams.
  12. Ensuring client (notably but not limited to Petrobras) financial processes are followed.

Any other tasks reasonably assigned to you by the CEO in writing from time to time.

Academic Competencies

Bachelor’s degree in engineering or relevant technical discipline

Master’s degree in appropriate business, engineering or science discipline

Membership of an accredited body relevant to the business (e.g. Project Management Institute)

Experience Competencies

Minimum 10 years’ experience in senior management positions in technical service organisations (preferably of a similar size and type as EM&I), preferably in Brazil.

Proven record of managing a technical service business with very high growth rates and demonstrating sustained high performance over at least a 3 year period.

Proven track record in delivering technical, high margin services to major clients such as Petrobras, Equinor, MODEC, Shell, and SBM.

Proven track record of strong working relationships with senior representatives of major clients, regulators and classification societies.

Proven understanding and ability to manage multi-company project based regions using project based financial reporting and aggregation reports, profit and loss management accounts, balance sheets, sales forecasts, cash flow forecasts, WIP and debt reports, and similar (working with the CFO and their team to understand taxation in Brazil, Guyana, and/or Mexico and potentially other South American countries would be an advantage).

Proven understanding and ability to manage client and supplier contracts and disputes.

Excellent oral and written communication skills in technical and business English and Brazilian Portuguese.

Proven ability to build, motivate and lead a strong team of technical, operational, and administrative personnel.

title: Analista de Inventário
description:
Na DB Schenker, você faz parte de uma rede global de logística que conecta o mundo . Uma rede que permite moldar sua carreira, incentivando você a contribuir e realmente fazer a diferença . Com mais de 76.000 colegas em todo o mundo, valorizamos a diversidade e prosperamos com as diferentes origens, perspectivas e habilidades individuais. Juntos, como uma única equipe, estamos aqui para movimentar.

Estamos buscando um Análista de Inventário para fazer parte da nossa equipe de Contract Logistics , para o nosso armazém localizado em Itupeva/SP. Dando suporte e contribuindo com nossos clientes locais na logística e armazenamento de diversos produtos.

Quais serão seus desafios?

Você será responsável por coordenar o controle de estoques, garantindo a precisão dos registros e evitando faltas ou excessos. Realizará inventários periódicos, reconciliando contagens físicas com os dados do sistema e investigando discrepâncias. Colaborará com outras áreas, como logística e compras, para melhorar a gestão de estoque. Analisará dados e proporá melhorias nos processos, além de preparar relatórios e monitorar KPIs.

Requisitos:

  • Experiência prévia em controle de estoques, inventário ou áreas afins.
  • Conhecimento de sistemas de gestão de estoque e ferramentas de automação.
  • Habilidade em análise de dados e uso de KPIs.
  • Capacidade de trabalhar em equipe e colaborar com diferentes departamentos.
  • Conhecimento em práticas de melhoria contínua e otimização de processos.
  • Formação em áreas relacionadas, como Logística, Administração ou afins (desejável).
  • Conhecimento em sistemas WMS.

Competências:

  • Atenção a detalhes e precisão no controle de informações.
  • Habilidade analítica para interpretar dados e identificar tendências e problemas no inventário.
  • Capacidade de colaboração interdepartamental para otimizar a gestão de estoque.
  • Proatividade na busca de melhorias nos processos e na implementação de melhores práticas.
  • Competência em elaboração de relatórios e interpretação de KPIs.
  • Organização e capacidade de gerenciar múltiplas tarefas simultaneamente.

Responsabilidades:

Controle e Análise de Inventário:

  • Monitorar o estoque de materiais e produtos em tempo real, garantindo a acuracidade e minimizando divergências.
  • Realizar contagens periódicas de inventário (cíclico e anual) e auditorias de estoque para assegurar a integridade das informações.

Gestão de Movimentações:

  • Controlar movimentações de entrada e saída de materiais, verificando a correspondência com as ordens de compra e venda.
  • Acompanhar o processo de devoluções e trocas de mercadorias, garantindo o correto registro de movimentações no sistema.

Análise de Dados e Relatórios:

  • Elaborar relatórios gerenciais sobre o desempenho dos estoques, indicadores de ruptura, nível de obsolescência e giro de estoque.
  • Analisar variações de inventário e identificar causas de perdas, propondo ações corretivas e preventivas.
  • Batimento entre os sistemas, a fim de garantir a acuracidade.
  • Realizar contagens físicas e confrontar com o sistema.

Aprimoramento de Processos:

  • Contribuir para a melhoria dos processos de controle de estoque, identificando oportunidades de otimização e automatização.
  • Apoiar a implementação de ferramentas e técnicas para melhorar a precisão do inventário (ex: WMS, RFID, leitura de código de barras).

Por que você vai amar a DB Schenker?

  • Alimentação no local;
  • Vale Alimentação;
  • Assistência Médica;
  • Assistência Odontológica;
  • WELLHUB – “Passe para academias” com planos em condições exclusivas;

Como Começar:

Você pode começar se inscrevendo acima ou nos visitando em

Mantenha-se Conectado Conosco:

A DB Schenker está comprometida com um ambiente de trabalho diverso e inclusivo. Somos uma empresa que oferece igualdade de oportunidades e não discrimina com base em cor, raça, gênero, identidade de gênero, orientação sexual, deficiência ou idade.

title: Tosador - Franquia Passo Fundo
description:
SEJA UM MICROFRANQUEADO DE SUCESSO!

É tosador e já pensou em empreender com baixo investimento, suporte completo e alto potencial de retorno? Então a microfranquia Pet Anjo é para você!
Estamos com oportunidades para quem deseja se tornar um microfranqueado de nossa marca, com o menor investimento para você construir sua história com a microfranquia pet que mais cresce no Brasil.

O QUE OFERECEMOS?
  1. Modelo de negócio testado e aprovado no mercado
  2. Equipamentos profissionais de qualidade
  3. Suporte contínuo em marketing, vendas e operação
  4. Expertise de mercado e uma empresa parceira da Cobasi

POR QUE INVESTIR NO MERCADO PET NO BRASIL?

Os animais de estimação estão cada vez mais presentes nos lares brasileiros, e seus tutores não medem esforços para garantir o melhor para eles! Seja na alimentação, bem-estar ou nos serviços de estética e atendimento veterinário, a demanda por cuidados de qualidade só cresce.
O mercado pet é uma oportunidade incrível para quem quer investir em um setor apaixonante e em constante expansão.

TORNE-SE UM MICROFRANQUEADO PET ANJO!

Aqui na Pet Anjo, chamamos de microfranquia porque a abertura do negócio irá demandar um baixo investimento inicial, já que equipamentos e estrutura são fornecidos pela franqueadora.
Isso significa que você tem a oportunidade de abrir o próprio negócio com estrutura já consolidada e um baixo investimento.

Como funciona?

Cada unidade Pet Anjo é formada por:

  1. Um franqueado médico-veterinário, responsável pela operação da clínica veterinária.
  2. O centro estético é composto por Profissionais tosadores, que realizam em seus boxes atividades relacionadas ao banho, tosa e estética animal.
Por que é ideal para você?
  1. Autonomia no gerenciamento do seu espaço.
  2. Suporte da franqueadora para o sucesso do negócio.
  3. Baixo custo inicial.

Perfil do franqueado Pet Anjo:
Espírito empreendedor: Conhecimento técnico na área; Disponibilidade para estar à frente da operação, com dedicação integral.

Paixão pelos Animais: Seja para atuar em clínica ou no centro estético, o amor pelos bichinhos é essencial! Cada atendimento deve ser feito com cuidado, atenção e carinho, garantindo o bem-estar dos nossos clientes de quatro patas.

Investimento:

Com a micro franquia Pet Anjo, você pode começar seu próprio negócio com o menor investimento inicial:
Box Banho & Tosa - Taxa de Franquia a partir de R$ 500.
Essa é a chance de transformar seu amor pelos pets em um negócio de sucesso!
